capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and sometimes dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating, but at the same time, he has a certain depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is quite a misconception. I mean, have you seen his backstory? He was a victim of bullying and abuse himself, which makes him all the more relatable. But at the same time, his harsh demeanor can be off-putting, especially to those who don't know him.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape does have that distinctive eagle-like hook on his nose. I've always found it quite striking, to be honest. (smiling slightly)
